briefTitle: Extension Study of V72P13 to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Immunogenicity of Novartis Meningococcal B Recombinant Vaccine When Administered as a Booster or as a Two-dose Catch-up to Healthy Toddlers
officialTitle: A Phase 3, Open Label, Multi-Center, Extension Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Immunogenicity of Novartis Meningococcal B Recombinant Vaccine When Administered as a Booster at 12 Months of Age or as a Two-dose Catch-up to Healthy Toddlers Who Participated in Study V72P13

interventions.name: 3b - 1 dose of rMenB+OMV NZ plus routine infant vaccinations

summary: The proposed study is an Extension Study of V72P13 to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Immunogenicity of Novartis Meningococcal B Recombinant Vaccine When Administered as a Booster at 12 Months of Age or as a Two-dose Catch-up to Healthy Toddlers

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentages of Subjects With Serum Bactericidal Antibody Titers â‰¥1:5 After Receiving the Booster Dose of rMenB+OMV NZ Vaccination
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: one month after the booster (fourth) dose
